ygData.subject: PROC, /loc, etc.
ygData.msgSnippet: 1. PROC - Perpetual Randomness Of Casting 2. Think of Loc as the incredibly generous minor god of geology who answers all prayers to him (/loc) by giving the
ygData.messageBody:
1. PROC - Perpetual Randomness Of Casting
2. Think of Loc as the incredibly generous minor god of geology who answers
all prayers to him (/loc) by giving the person in question their
co-ordinates (which he used when drawing up the blueprints for Norrath)
Now, can we get away from nit-picking personal prefernces in gaming-styles
and back to more bard-ish stuff?
3. A truly hardcore RP'r would quit the game and never play again once he
died (or, if he really liked the game and believed re-incarnation were
possible on Norrath, would never inform anyone -even friends- of his new
character's identity.)
Like maybe... "What is the benefit/loss (if any) in the various instrument
types? (ie: Lute vs Mandolin)?" (Still waiting on an answer to that one)
Also, I looked over the bard site that was mentioned in an earlier letter,
and I must say I found the site quite informative. (Especially the
as-complete-as-currently-possible spellsong list)

Just an opinion,
-=B=-
Das UberBard
18th season of bardic training
The Rathe
